channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: When her car ran out of gas, help came from a homeless encampment
item.description: When Juli Cobb's car ran out of gas in the middle of the road, three men from a nearby homeless encampment rushed over to push her car to safety.

item.title: What we know about the accused shooter of Charlie Kirk
item.description: Utah Governor Cox and others have labeled the accused shooter of Charlie Kirk a "leftist." But extremism analysts say the only clear indication so far is that he was deeply into online meme culture.

item.title: A surprising new treatment for rheumatoid arthritis
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved a device that uses electrical stimulation to reduce inflammation from rheumatoid arthritis.

item.title: The far-right and what it means to be British
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Labour MP Clive Lewis about the far-right "free-speech" march in London last weekend.

item.title: RFK Jr.'s vaccine panel is expected to recommend delaying hepatitis B shot in kids
item.description: A vaccine advisory panel, recently reshaped by RFK Jr., is expected to vote on changing the age children should get their first hepatitis B vaccine -- from right after birth to age 4.

item.title: Author Angela Flournoy explores 20 years of adult friendship in 'The Wilderness'
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks to author Angela Flournoy about how millennial friendships evolve in middle age as explored in her new novel, "The Wilderness."

item.title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, a UN inquiry says
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Navi Pillay, who chairs a U.N. commission on the Occupied Palestinian Territory, which has found Israel is committing genocide in Gaza.

item.title: On Capitol Hill, FBI Director Patel faces questions over his leadership
item.description: FBI Director Kash Patel faced heated questions from Democrats over his handling of the bureau in the wake of the assassination of political organizer Charlie Kirk.

item.title: The Union Jack at anti-immigrant rallies sparks debate on what it means to be British
item.description: Aside from soccer or royal events, Brits don't fly their flag as much as Americans do. Now, with anti-immigrant groups embracing the Union Jack, it's part of a debate on what it means to be British.

item.title: Israel begins large offensive in Gaza City as airstrikes kill scores
item.description: Israel says new phase of the war in Gaza has begun as troops make push to takeover and occupy Gaza City.
